intro: Aconitella saccata, commonly known as the sac囊 aconite, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, showy flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant features simple, trifoliate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in racemes. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its toxic alkaloids, it is considered a poisonous plant and should be handled with care.
